db:info.db:title: Windows CE - Introduction to using Qt

db:abstract.db:para: An introduction to Qt for Windows CE developers.

db:section.db:title: Required Tools
db:section.db:para: In order to use Qt for Windows CE you need to have Visual Studio 2005 or 2008 and at least one of the supported Windows CE/Mobile SDKs installed. Note, that the Visual Studio 2008 Standard Edition doesn't come with Windows CE support. You will need the Professional Edition, if you're using Visual Studio 2008.

db:section.db:title: Installing Qt
db:section.db:para: Follow the instructions found in Installing Qt for Windows CE.

db:section.db:title: Building Your Own Applications
db:section.db:para: If you are new to Qt development, have a look at Qt Overviews and Tutorials. In general there is little or no difference in developing Qt applications for Windows CE compared to any of the other platforms supported by Qt.

db:section.db:title: Running the Application
db:section.db:para: In order to run the application, it needs to be deployed on the Windows CE/Mobile device you want to test it for. This can either be done manually or automated using Visual Studio.

To do it manually, simply copy the executable, the Qt .dll files needed for the application to run, and the C-runtime library into a folder on the device, and then click on the executable to start the program. You can either use the Explorer found in ActiveSync or the Remote File Viewer found in Visual Studio to do this.
Further information on deploying Qt applications for Windows can be found in the deployment document.
